sen.e: Kyoto City, designated by government ordinance, has the seventh largest population of all the cities in Japan including the special wards of Tokyo, and during the daytime, the city boasts the sixth largest population, surpassing Kobe City.

sen.j: 平安時代に平安京が置かれた都市で、室町時代にも足利幕府が置かれた。
sen.e: In the same city where Heian-kyo was established in the Heian period, the Government of Ashikaga, Ashikaga Bakufu, was placed in the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: 又、平安京成立後から明治天皇が東京市に行幸するまでの約1080年、ほぼ全ての天皇が居住していた都市である（→首都に関する議論は「日本の首都」を参照すること）。

sen.j: 平安時代以降、平安京の都市生活者向けの商工業が発達し、特に国内流通が活発化した江戸時代には、全国に製品を出荷する工業都市となる一方、数々の技術者を各地の藩の要請に従って派遣した。
sen.e: From the Heian period, the commerce and industry for urban dwellers in Heian-kyo developed, and especially in the Edo period when the domestic distribution became prevalent, Kyoto City became an industrial city to ship goods nationwide and provided technicians to local clans upon request.

sen.e: Kyoto City still has its legacy as can be seen in traditional handicraft; furthermore, with industry-leading companies such as Nintendo and Wacoal Holdings Corporation, and high-tech companies such as Kyocera Corporation and Shimadzu Corporation being headquartered in the city, Kyoto is becoming one of the areas to sustain current industries.

sen.j: 幕末、にわかに政治の中心地となった京都は人口が膨れ上がりかつてない活況を見せたものの、禁門の変で街の多くが焼けたのに加え、明治維新後に皇室・公家の大半が東京へ移り住んだため、一転急速な衰退を見せた。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, Kyoto City suddenly became the political center, thrived more than ever with the explosive growth of population, but soon declined because a large part of the city was burned down in the Kinmon Rebellion and moreover many of the imperial family and the court nobles moved to Tokyo.

sen.e: To meet the population growth and the urban development, 'three big projects' were undertaken from the end of the Meiji period: road extension and the construction of Kyoto City streetcar system, the construction of canals at Lake Biwa, and the construction of the water supply system.

sen.j: 第2次世界大戦中、三大都市圏六大都市（東京・大阪・京都・横浜・神戸・名古屋）の中では唯一空襲の大きな被害を受けなかったこともあり、日本の都市としては珍しく、戦前からの建造物が比較的多く残されている。
sen.e: Kyoto City still has a relatively large number of pre-war buildings, not typical of Japanese cities, as Kyoto City was the only city that did not suffer major damage from air strikes during World War II among the six biggest cities of the three major metropolitan areas (Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto, Yokohama, Kobe, and Nagoya).

sen.j: 平安京では、唐が西の長安を首都、東の洛陽を副都としたのを意識し、朱雀大路の西を長安（右京）、東（左京）を洛陽と称した。
sen.e: Being aware of the way the Tang dynasty designated Chang'an in the west as the capital and Luoyang in the east as the second capital, Heian-kyo referred to the area to the west of Suzaku-oji Avenue as Choan (Chang'an) or Ukyo and the one to the east as Rakuyo (Luoyang) or Sakyo.

sen.j: その後、低湿地であった右京が寂れ、人口も御所などの重要施設も左京に集中するに伴い、洛陽が平安京の代名詞となっていった。
sen.e: Ukyo, being located on the damp ground, declined over the years, and Rakuyo was mainly used to refer to Heian-kyo as the population and the main facilities concentrated in Sakyo.

sen.j: 東海道・山陽新幹線沿線からは、大阪市内や神戸市内と比べて関西地区の各空港との距離が離れている事（一番近い大阪国際空港でも1時間はかかる）や、京都駅にのぞみ (列車)をはじめ全ての列車が停車することから、新幹線が航空機に対して圧倒的に優位に立っている。
sen.e: From places along the Tokaido and Sanyo Shinkansen Lines, the Shinkansen has a clear advantage over airplanes since, compared to Osaka City and Kobe City, Kyoto City is far away from airports in the Kansai area (at least one hour away from the nearest airport 'Osaka International Airport') and every train including the Nozomi stops at Kyoto Station.

sen.j: また、京都府内のみならず、大阪府北東部や滋賀県南部および奈良県北部への新幹線の玄関口としての機能も持つ。
sen.e: Kyoto Station, moreover, is the gateway of the Shinkanse not only to places within Kyoto Prefecture but also to the northeastern part of Osaka Prefecture, the southern part of Shiga Prefecture, and the northern part of Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 京都市は、明治維新以降は発展と保全をバランスよく保っていた。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, Kyoto City has maintained a proper balance between development and conservation.
Since the Meiji Restoration, Kyoto City has maintained a proper balance between development and conservation.
Since the Meiji Restoration, Kyoto City has maintained a proper balance between development and conservation.

sen.j: しかし、戦後になると経済優先の政策により徐々に景観が破壊され、街並みが壊されることに対する景観論争も起こっている。
sen.e: However, after World War II, policies to priotize the economy has been taken, and, as a result, the landscape has been gradually destroyed, stirring up the debate on the issue of landscape.

However, since World War II policies designed to prioritize the economy have been implemented, and as a result the landscape has gradually been destroyed, stirring up a debate on the issue of landscape.

However, since World War II policies designed to prioritize the economy have been implemented, and as a result the landscape has gradually been destroyed, stirring up a debate on the issue of landscape.

sen.j: 1964年に建造された京都タワーは、京都の第1次景観論争を引き起こした。
sen.e: Kyoto Tower built in 1964 gave rise to the first cityscape dispute in Kyoto City.
Kyoto Tower, built in 1964, gave rise to the first cityscape dispute in Kyoto City.
Kyoto Tower, built in 1964, gave rise to the first cityscape dispute in Kyoto City.

sen.j: また1970年代の経済成長期には、戦前からの風致地区や美観地区などの制度にもかかわらず、1950年に制定された建築基準法により伝統工法が違法となり、バブル期には多くの建替えにより京町家による街並みが徐々に壊されていった。
sen.e: During the period of economic growth in the 1970's, the Building Standards Act enacted in 1950 made the traditional methods of construction illegal despite the systems of fuchi-chiku and bikan-chiku established before World War II, and consequently, during the bubble years when many of the houses were rebuilt, the streetscape of 'Kyo-machiya' or traditional Kyoto town houses had been slowly destroyed.
sen.cmt: 前半部分が曖昧です。特に、「1970年代の経済成長期には」がどこにかかるかが不明です。多分、「1970年代の経済成長期や、特にバブル期には、～建て替えられ、～壊された」ってことでしょうか。http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110004201118/http://www.kyoto-np.co.jp/kp/topics/eng/2008nov/11-10.html
sen.e: During the period of economic growth in the 1970s, the Building Standards Act of 1950 made the traditional methods of construction illegal despite the systems of fuchi-chiku and bikan-chiku established before World War II; and consequently, during the bubble years when many of the houses were rebuilt, the streetscape of 'Kyo-machiya' or traditional Kyoto town houses had been slowly destroyed.

During the period of economic growth in the 1970s, the Building Standards Act of 1950 made the traditional methods of construction illegal despite the systems of fuchi-chiku (landscape area) and bikan-chiku (aesthetic area) established before World War II; and consequently, during the bubble years when many of the houses were rebuilt, the streetscape of Kyo-machiya or traditional Kyoto town houses were destroyed.
sen.cmt: '削除風致地区と美観地区の説明を追加しました。

sen.j: これは第2次景観論争といわれている。
sen.e: This is known as the second cityscape dispute.
This is known as the second cityscape dispute.
This is known as the second cityscape dispute.

sen.j: 山並みも京都の都市景観の重要な要素である。
sen.e: The landscape of the mountains is also an important element in the cityscape of Kyoto.
The landscape of the mountains is also an important element in the cityscape of Kyoto.
The landscape of the mountains is also an important element in the cityscape of Kyoto.

sen.j: 山間地での開発は概ね抑制されているが、1990年代には市内の高層建築によって山への眺望景観が阻害されることになった。
sen.e: Development in the mountain area was in general restrained, but high-rise buildings constructed in the city in 1990's spoiled the scenery to the mountains from the city.
Development in the mountain area was generally restrained, but high-rise buildings constructed in the city in the 1990s spoiled the view of the mountains from the city.
Development in the mountain area was generally restrained, but high-rise buildings constructed in the city in the 1990s spoiled the view of the mountains from the city.

sen.j: 市街地では、都市景観を乱す恐れのある派手な広告看板を条例で禁止している。
sen.e: The city enacted an ordinance prohibiting flashy advertisements in the urban area that might spoil the cityscape.
The city enacted an ordinance prohibiting flashy advertisements in the urban area that might spoil the cityscape.
The city enacted an ordinance prohibiting flashy advertisements in the urban area that might spoil the cityscape.

sen.j: そのため、有名なチェーン店店鋪の看板も、鮮やかなコーポレートカラーの使用を控え、日本の他の地域とは異なる地味な配色を採用する事例も多い。
sen.e: As a result, even well-known chain stores often refrain from using their bright corporate colors for the store sign, and instead utilize plain coloration different from the stores in other areas of Japan.

As a result, even well-known chain stores often refrain from using their bright corporate colors for the store signs but instead use plain coloration that is different from the stores in other parts of Japan.

As a result, even well-known chain stores often refrain from using their bright corporate colors for the store signs but instead use plain coloration that is different from the stores in other parts of Japan.

sen.j: マクドナルド、すき家の看板は他地域では紅系統のものだが、京都市では赤褐色に変えている。
sen.e: McDonald's and Sukiya change the color of the store signs to red brown in Kyoto City even though they use bright red in other areas..
McDonald's and Sukiya change the color of the store signs to reddish brown in Kyoto City, even though they use bright red in other areas..
McDonald's and Sukiya change the colors of their store signs to reddish brown in Kyoto City, even though they use bright red in other areas.

sen.j: 一部の市内のローソンも明るい青ではなく、濃い藍色に色を変更している。
sen.e: Some of the LAWSON stores in the city use blue black instead of bright blue.
Some of the LAWSON stores in the city use blue black instead of bright blue.
Some of the LAWSON stores in the city use blue black instead of bright blue.

sen.j: また、ジャパンエナジー、新日本石油なども、本来の企業カラーを全面的に使用せず、ロゴマーク部分を白地、または落ち着きのある色を使うものにしているのもある。
sen.e: And also companies such as Japan Energy Corporation and Nippon Oil Corporation use white or quiet color for their logos in stead of using their usual corporate colors.
Also, companies such as Japan Energy Corporation and Nippon Oil Corporation use white or subdued colors for their logos instead of using their usual corporate colors.
Also, companies such as Japan Energy Corporation and Nippon Oil Corporation use white or subdued colors for their logos instead of using their usual corporate colors.

sen.j: 市外局番は、大部分の地域は「075」（京都単位料金区域）。
sen.e: The area code is '075' in most of the areas (Message Area of Kyoto.)
The area code is '075' in most of the areas (Message Area of Kyoto).
The area code is '075' in most of the areas (Message Area of Kyoto).

sen.j: ただし、右京区嵯峨樒原、嵯峨越畑、旧京北町域では「0771」（亀岡MA）。
sen.e: However, the area code is '0711' in the areas of Shikimigahara Saga Ukyo Ward, Saga Koshihata, and Keihoku-cho (Message Area of Kameoka.)
However, the area code is '0711' in the areas of Shikimigahara Saga Ukyo ward, Saga Koshihata and Keihoku-cho (Message Area of Kameoka).
However, the area code is '0771' in the areas of Sagashikimigahara and Sagakoshihata in Ukyo Ward and the former Keihoku-cho area (Message Area of Kameoka).
sen.cmt: 0771に修正 Sagashikimigahara, Sagakoshihata としました。

sen.j: 東京と京都を区別する際には、東京は「京」、京都は「洛」と略されて区別される。
sen.e: When distinguishing Tokyo and Kyoto, the following abbreviations are used: 'kyo' for Tokyo and 'raku' for Kyoto.
When distinguishing between Tokyo and Kyoto, the following abbreviations are used: 'kyo' for Tokyo and 'raku' for Kyoto.
When distinguishing between Tokyo and Kyoto, the following abbreviations are used: 'kyo' for Tokyo and 'raku' for Kyoto.

sen.j: 東京を含めて、外の地方から京都に入る事は、現在でも「京都に上る」という意味で「上洛する」と言われる。
sen.e: The word 'jo-raku-suru' meaning 'climb up Kyoto' is used to describe when one visits from local cities including Tokyo to Kyoto.
The word 'jo-raku-suru,' meaning 'climb up Kyoto,' is used to describe when one visits from a nearby city, including from Tokyo to Kyoto.
The word 'jo-raku-suru,' meaning 'climb up Kyoto,' is used to describe when one visits Kyoto from another area such as Tokyo.

sen.j: 日本プロサッカーリーグ京都サンガF.C.の本拠地。
sen.e: The city is home to Kyoto Sanga F.C.

sen.j: 京都市役所のホームページの外郭色は紫だが、これは「山紫水明」に因んだ色である。
sen.e: The color of outer bailey... is purple, based on the word 'Sanshisuimei' or scenic beauty.

sen.e: The outer color of barley... is purple, based on the word 'sanshisuimei,' or scenic beauty.
